Hiring_Company: Great Eastern Life Assurance Co Ltd
Job_Descriptions: Job Purpose Lead the Group IT Security, Risk and Compliance team and oversee the IT and Cyber security initiatives and operations across the Great Eastern Group, and enable effective management of technology and IT operational risk and compliance in line with the GRC framework of Great Eastern. The Job Develop and deliver Cyber Security Roadmap with a robust plan for continuous cybersecurity improvement and in compliance with regulation. Establish the Group Technology Security Standards and associated guidelines. Oversee the delivery of security operation and assurance review to Group IT, covering application security review, security testing, patch and vulnerability management, network & endpoint security review, and security operation centre (SOC) for cyber security monitoring. Conduct exercise to enhance the detection and response capability to Cybersecurity threats, such as purple/red teaming, cyber range, bug bounty, cyber drills and threat hunting. Support the Business in carrying our 3rd party outsourcing security risk review. Provide security updates and security risk metrics reporting to Senior Management and Board. Develop and implement programs to promote awareness on good practices in IT security, risk and compliance. Oversee the service level and performance of Managed security services provider (MSSP) in their delivery of security monitoring services Engage and manage relationships with local regulators and auditors in audits, inspection or matters concerning Group IT. Provide reporting of cyber incidents to regulators. Be the key liaison and coordinator with GRM. Assume the role of Division Risk & Compliance officer (DRCO) for Group IT. Monitor technology risk profile, such as reporting of key risk indicators and key metrics, analysing risk trends and recommending improvements. Oversee technology risk management process, which includes IT risk acceptance process, maintain risk registers such as RCSA, IT outsourcing risks and Project Risk Assessment (PRA), monitor the action plan closure, and facilitate risk forums / committees, templates and tools. Communicate and coordinate the implementation and execution of risk management policies and guidelines, programmes and activities in the division, such as RCSA, IT outsourcing risk assessment, fraud risk assessment, and annual GEH Assurance. Ensure compliance with laws, regulations and guidelines that are applicable to the division at all times, e.g. submit the Regulation Impact Assessment Matrix and Compliance self-assessment (CRSA) timely to GRM. Manage the reporting of risk, compliance and data incidents in accordance with GRM and DPGO guidelines. As part of the leadership team, work with key stakeholders to proactively shape the organisation's culture and conduct environment that is aligned to the organization's Core Values Champion culture and conduct behavioral expectations within the Department/Division. Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices. Our Requirements A Bachelor's degree or Professional Degree in Computer Science / IT or equivalent At least 12 years relevant experience managing and monitoring IT security, risk and compliance; including five (5) years of managing security operations and teams. Currently holding a leadership position or have been in a similar capacity. Have experience in leading a team in terms of design and assessment of IT security solutions, preferably in a financial services environment. Security industry certifications such as CISSP, CISM, SANS, GSEC, etc are preferred. A proven record of dealing with complex projects and meeting conflicting demands Ability to adapt to a fast-moving Cyber security landscape and keep pace with latest thinking and new security technologies Thrives on change, showing an impressive ability to drive the IT security strategy forward Forms business partnerships that help drive the IT security strategy forward In-depth understanding of TCP/IP protocol and OSI Seven Layer Model. Expert technical knowledge of network security technologies (firewall, IPS/IDS, etc). Strong technical knowledge of Windows and/or Unix-based systems/ architectures and related security. Strong knowledge of security best practices and concepts. Advance knowledge & Hands-on experience on enterprise IT Security solutions. Advance level of knowledge of LAN / WAN technologies Knowledge of VPN technologies. Be able to articulate threats and risk to business and technology leaders. Strong experience in Security monitoring, SIEM and Security Operations Centre (SOC). Advanced knowledge of risk assessment design and delivery. Experience working with internal and external auditors. Work collaboratively and independently. Detail oriented with strong organizational and prioritization skills. Perform multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent communicator with strong influencing skill set and able to manage conflicts Team player who can lead in brainstorm session with peers to problem solve and make decisions Self driven with a positive attitude to champion for culture change management initiatives Strong initiative and leadership Analytical skills and a creative approach to problem solving Presentation skills for delivering workshops and escalating business impacting issues Demonstrates alignment with the organisation's core values through expected behaviours. High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork. Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes. About Great Eastern Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner. We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us. We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions. Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people's lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management. Job_Title: Senior Sales Mgr- Metallic with commodity trading MNC
Job_Descriptions: Senior Sales Mgr- Metallic with commodity trading MNC Has strong Base Metals Market fundamentals. Strong technical understanding of the Copper metallics market, including and not limited to pricing mechanisms, arbitrages and hedging operations. Strong understanding of marketing fundamentals (ie. pricing, delivery strategy, value chain dynamics, net back calculations). Our client is a renowned and global Commodity Trading MNC (based in town). The Base & Specialty Metals Marketing team is a critical and significant contributor to the Marketing EBIT target for this MNC. The Marketing Copper team is aiming to deliver additional value by implementing a trading strategy to exploit opportunities through more asset-backed trading. The aim of our marketing & sales strategy is to become one of the top marketing businesses in the world within the next 5 years in terms of volume and profit generation. In order to achieve the firm's ambitious goals, this manager has a key role to play in terms of the integrated value chain and maximization of value to the business. This role will also manage the global Metallics book in terms of optimization and execution to ensure the highest sustainable value generation. Key in this is to have a fully integrated view with a focus on value maximization but also supporting the trading desk analytically on commercial transactions and developing optimization strategies for new products e.g. gold/silver. This role can be based in Singapore or London. Key functions: Leadership Provide guidance and leadership to the Book Owner team regarding overall global Metallics book optimisation and execution opportunities Own daily meeting with regional managers and traders, maintaining and curating the list with business opportunities. Accountable for the overall book and business optimization of metallics considering a holistic view of the inputs from Regional Sales Managers, technical manager, supporting functions and Marketing Intelligence views. Metallics strategy and execution: Support the Head of Marketing and Sales in the strategic direction of the business. Core in this role is copper metallics but also support required as we expand into other products. Responsible for the execution of the short to medium term commercial strategy. Pivotal role in the development and execution of the downstream and customer's customers business plan. Lead, support and encourage regional sales manager business. By exception engage with customers and suppliers in coordination with regional sales managers and maintain customer relations when needed (ie. Regional manager on leave, unallocated new customers, large accounts with worldwide presence). On a day to day own the optimization decisions for those market risks owned by the Marketing and Sales team with a particular focus on the physical product and regional arbitrage opportunities which may exist. Work closely with ISOP and their relation with the firm's assets to ensure the firm fully leverages on its long position but also bring a fully integrated view to the decision making process. This includes providing critical thinking to the asset on scenario planning as they make their own optimization based decisions. Work closely with the customer facing sales managers to understand and support in client driven solutions as well as a full understanding of the future book being managed Work closely with the trading team to ensure end to end value is maximized. Liaising with ISOP team to monitor production update and logistic progress and feed this into portfolio based decisions. Working with sale operations on monthly declaration and logistic related matters. Look for digital and system based solutions to maximise the value to Marketing e.g. book optimization tool developed by the Digital Hive. Risk & Governance Maintain and integrate the commodity trading approval processes. Ensure all activities are compliant with Marketing's risk framework. Maintain systems with contract information (e.g. matching sales and purchases) on a timely and accurate basis. Produce ad hoc and monthly performance reporting for Front Office, liaison with Risk and Finance. Stakeholder Management Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders in the production Business Unit, Risk Management and Accounting. Coordinate efforts with Sourcing and Origination team owning relations with counterparties when needed. Qualifications: Degree qualified with min 12 to 15 years of total exp Has strong Base Metals Market fundamentals. Know the Industry counterparts and global trade-flows. Strong technical understanding of the Copper metallics market, including and not limited to pricing mechanisms, arbitrages and hedging operations. Theories & Principles of international commodity marketing and sales Strong understanding of marketing fundamentals (ie. pricing, delivery strategy, value chain dynamics, net back calculations). Strong corporate liaison skills, both internally and externally. Experience within a complex organisation across different countries and jurisdictions, cultures, interfacing with internal and external stakeholders. Strong written and spoken communication skills. Entrepreneurial mindset Analytical minded - able to disaggregate problems and make quantitative estimates of value creation for initiatives. Cultural sensitivity and ability to work across cultural boundaries To apply, pls send your cv in word doc to . Pls also include details on your current salary, expected salary and notice period in your cv. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. You will work in close collaboration with Digital R&D Team members located in Wageningen Innovation Center, Netherlands.

What the role is As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family. Information Technology IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board’s IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems. What you will be working on This role sits within the Business Incubator and Accelerator department, a new department set up to strategise, spearhead and facilitate enterprise transformation in CPF Board. We are looking for someone who is driven and able to lead a team of officers to execute and grow the strategy for Incubator & Accelerator programmes, working closely with business users, technical teams, internal and external stakeholders. This specific officer is in charge of driving Innovation through a series of programmes creating avenues for officers to tap on our pool of python, artificial intelligence, RPA and LSS experts/resources easily, and getting involved as project manager or technical support for critical/key projects. In addition, he/she supports horizontal frontier tech exploration initiatives in their change management and upskilling initiatives. Drive Innovation programmes, designing and executing courses for maximum effectiveness by running “intrapreneur” programmes, source for industry immersions, strategic partnership, business team collaborations, and planning the programmes at Incubator Space to ensure a constant stream of interesting activities and programmes to spark curiosity and encourage learning in CPFB officers Improve existing programme design and methodology, and lead the ideation and business development process of new programmes Facilitate discovery and demand-supply matching process by organising co-creation sessions with customers and conduct social listening that in a way that is meaningful and generates value Engage with startups and entrepreneurs to garner feedback for constant improvement and build a database of trainers, mentors and industry partners Build a pipeline of future talent who can get exposure via internship with us by exploring new sources of talent and upskill existing staff Deliver key projects as a project manager through hands-on involvement Support horizontal frontier tech exploration initiatives in their change management by creating governance frameworks such as task automation guidelines, micro-services catalogue, proof-of-concept framework, adoption framework etc Showcase officers to internal and external stakeholders by creating opportunities to reward and motivate innovation in staff Active communication with the current stakeholders and past alumni to report on effectiveness of the programmes. Implement customer usage metrics & reporting, with a strong focus on improving customer experience. What we are looking for Relevant experience working in and facilitating accelerator programmes or innovation portfolio, project management, administration, coordination and event management in a large organisation A self-starting problem solver who is able to run with concepts with minimal direction, able to multi-task and work effectively in a team Intellectually curious, with proven ability to learn and pick up new skills, especially in technology and data Passionate about helping others achieve success in their various transformative endeavour and journey High attention to detail while being technically creative and open-minded Vision to own and drive programs with development horizons of months or years. Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as leadership skills. Strong creative, analytical and problem-solving skills to effectively evaluate complex information and make appropriate decisions in ambiguous situations. Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage, influence and win buy-in and commitment from key stakeholders across all levels Project Management, Scrum Master, Business Process Reengineering, Human-centred design and/or Change Management certification will be a bonus Hands-on experience with RPA, VBA, SQL, Tableau, POC for new tech will be a bonus Position will be on 2-year contract The seniority of appointment will be commensurate with relevant work experience. Flexible remote work arrangements, though some face-time in office is still required.

Carousell is the leading classifieds group in Greater Southeast Asia on a mission to inspire the world to start selling, and to make secondhand the first choice. Founded in August 2012 in Singapore, the group has a leading presence in eight markets under the brands Carousell, Mudah.my, Cho Tot, OneKyat and Ox Street, serving tens of millions of monthly active users. We have three technology development centres in Singapore, Taiwan and India, as well as offices in Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Carousell is backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, STIC Investments and Sequoia Capital India. As a team of passionate individuals working together to solve meaningful problems, there is so much more for you to discover in a career with Carousell. Our culture is made up of hiring, developing, and promoting people who embody our values of solving problems for our users; having a mission-first mindset; being relentlessly resourceful; caring deeply; and staying humble to constantly improve. Together as an organisation, we make magic happen. About the role We are looking for a senior product leader to join our tech leadership team and take ownership of classifieds monetization product domains for Carousell’s marketplace with our Classifieds business unit: Paying and Pro Users, and Verticals. This business unit is responsible for most of the revenue generated from our classifieds marketplaces. Paying Users Carousell helps different segments of sellers sell with ease - ranging from individuals to more frequent casual sellers to professional business owners and merchants. We offer these users a suite of paid products to improve their chances of success, and grow and manage their business. These products include advertising tools to promote listings, target specific audiences and manage sales and customers on Carousell. The charter is to maximize success of these paying sellers while ensuring a great buyer experience as well. Verticals Buying and selling in Verticals, such as Autos, Property and Services, is very different from buying a second hand dress or selling your kid’s old toy. To provide a great experience for car buyers, sellers and dealers; property buyers, sellers, agents and developers; services seekers and small businesses providing services, it’s important to understand the nuances of these verticals, and build products and user experiences that cater to them. The charter is to grow our vertical marketplaces, delighting all segments of buyers and sellers, and to grow revenue by sharing in value created with the relatively higher proportion of professional sellers in these categories. You will lead a lean team of 4 product managers responsible for these domains, partnering closely with business unit heads, as well as engineering, design and data leaders. The role is based in Singapore and reports to the CTO. You will: Lead product strategy and collaborate on business strategy with stakeholders Attract, coach and retain empowered product managers, who enjoy working in innovation, user-focused solutions, and thrive in a fast paced, fun environment Inspire the team to dream big and innovate to delight users Foster a culture of continuous improvement through mentoring, feedback and metrics Set clear measurable goals for your product managers and the tech teams of designers, engineers, data scientists and analysts they work with Combine usage data, market and user research, and industry best practises to understand the domain deeply and identify user problems and breakthrough opportunities Work with a diverse set of internal and external stakeholders to quickly build products and services that create significant value for users and revenue for the company Champion product management functional excellence across Carousell Attitude and behaviours critical to success To be successful in this role you must be dedicated to Carousell’s mission and care deeply about our users. In addition to focusing on flawless execution you will have high energy, intellectual curiosity, and a proven track record of delivering results. When data is not available, you must rely on your instincts and judgment to make high quality decisions quickly. You will have demonstrated: User obsession and empathy. Drive and resourcefulness to persevere and overcome obstacles achieving challenging goals. Focus on impact and results. You work on the right things and get them done. Exceptional product and business judgement. Willingness and ability to take smart risks and fail forward. Strategic awareness, financial fluency and a strong understanding of a profit and loss account. Track record of successfully solving complex and ambiguous problems. High integrity and ability to positively collaborate with others Ability to think, speak and write succinctly and clearly. Analytical skills to understand & generate insights from user data. 10+ years of industry experience, including 7+ years of Product Management experience, preferably in a customer/user facing organization Bachelor’s degree, with strong academic record, in Computer Science or a related field such as Math, Physics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, or Business Administration. Masters preferred. Good To Have People management and development experience with geographically distributed, remote teams By clicking on Submit, you are accepting to our PDPA policies. In case you are interested to know more, read about our Candidates Personal Data Privacy Statement [https://support.carousell.com/hc/en-us/articles/4410378144537-Candidates-Personal-Data-Privacy-Statement].

Ripple is growing and we’re looking for a Summer Intern to join our Institutional Markets team based in Singapore The ideal candidate will be interested in technology, blockchain, cryptocurrencies, and financial markets; and will have some relevant, analytical professional experience involving one or multiple of these fields, as well as some history of educational and professional success. An ideal candidate should have some experience in doing quantitative and qualitative analysis and leveraging that analysis into building data-driven presentations and dashboards. Proficiency in Excel is valued, and a statistical programming stack such as Python/NumPy/Pandas would be a plus; but most importantly, the candidate’s attitude, willingness and ability to learn will be prioritized. This Summer Intern will support and work closely with a team of financial professionals on the Institutional Markets team, responsible for managing and expanding XRP liquidity and utility. Ripple’s vision of an Internet of Value requires digital asset efficiency and a healthy crypto market, and robust liquidity is a core component of making that vision a reality. We’re looking for a smart and adaptable junior professional who is looking for a high-impact role with a rapidly growing company at the intersection of finance and technology. WHAT YOU’LL DO: Support Ripple’s ability to navigate the broader blockchain landscape and XRP Markets on topics such as liquidity, decentralized finance and market adoption Build robust analytics and craft clear, data-driven visualizations and presentations to help with market performance assessments for a variety of audiences, including Ripple’s external partners, customers, and our own senior leadership Learn about the digital asset markets, helping the team compose deep analysis of those markets to inform the company’s strategy and decision-making Work with internal teams in supporting the broader company’s efforts WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR: 0 - 3 years experience in markets, finance, management consulting, or technology 1 - 3 years educational/professional experience in Excel. Also, Python/NumPy/Pandas or similar technology stacks is a plus (but not required) A basic understanding of trading markets: traditional, crypto or both Ability to work cross functionally with internal stakeholders Passion for fintech, markets, and Ripple’s vision of the Internet of Value Excellent verbal and written communication skills Attention to detail and a commitment to excellence Experience with cloud computing and storage is a plus, preferably GCS BS/BA in Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or another analytic discipline WHAT WE OFFER: The chance to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact Modern office in San Francisco’s Financial District Fully-stocked kitchen with organic snacks, beverages, and coffee drinks Weekly company meeting - ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team Team outings to sports games, happy hours, game nights and more! What the role is The Research and Strategy Management Division at the Ministry of National Development comprises of the Research and Data Analytics Resource (RaDAR) Unit and the Strategy Management Unit. The RaDAR Unit conducts research studies to inform policy work. The Strategy Management Unit provides alignment and coordination for policy and planning within the MND family and across whole-of-government. The division also has an international relations team which oversees our engagement with foreign counterparts and an emergency preparedness team which oversees and coordinates the organisation’s role during national emergencies. We would like to invite interested applicants to apply for a position as a Research Economist/Senior Research Economist with the RaDAR Unit. You will be part of a dynamic and multi-disciplinary team that provides timely and relevant research output to policy divisions and Senior Management to inform the policy making process. What you will be working on You will undertake research and analysis on issues that are relevant to the Ministry to enable evidence-based policy formulation. Some of these issues include: Assessing and monitoring public housing affordability, as well as understanding the public housing needs of Singaporeans; Developing surveillance capabilities to better understand key drivers that affect property market prices in Singapore; Deepening our knowledge of housing and related social issues faced by different population segments and the efficacy of related policies; and Understanding the social cohesiveness of our community and residents’ sentiments toward the living environment. What we are looking for We are looking for applicants with the following traits: Qualifications and/or relevant experience in Economics, Data Science and other relevant fields; Strong interest in housing-related research, and ability to think creatively on how data can be used to inform policy; Proficiency in econometric techniques required for carrying out complex data analysis (e.g. regression analysis and various policy evaluation methods); Experience and ability to utilise data analytics tools to prepare and analyse data (e.g. R and STATA); Background and experience in machine learning, data visualisation and/or usage of GIS tools will be an advantage; Have excellent communication and writing skills to express complex ideas simply and logically; and Be able to work effectively both individually and in multi-disciplinary teams. Applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing of this job posting.

What the role is As an inspector with the Inspection and Compliance Division, you are responsible for supervising casino operators to ensure compliance with the internal controls standards and other regulatory requirements of the Casino Control Act and its subsidiary legislation. What you will be working on You will report to Assistant Director / Senior Assistant Director (Inspection and Compliance) and be part of a team of inspectors who inspect the casinos for regulatory compliance on-site, handle and resolve patron disputes, process applications submitted by the casinos on new areas or changes to existing areas of casino operations, and investigate non-compliances within the casinos. You will also be assigned to review operational framework and policies. You will have the opportunity to be posted to other Divisions within the Casino Regulatory Authority to experience other aspects of casino regulatory duties and responsibilities, as part of your development as a regulator. You will get to interact with people from different walks of life and be at the forefront of Singapore’s casino regulatory regime. What we are looking for Knowledge in Accountancy, Economics, Business or Information Technology (IT) related fields Prior work experience in audit, IT audit and compliance will be an advantage Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Experience or knowledge in data analytics Adaptable and able to work in a fast-paced environment Prepared to work during weekends and public holidays when required Ability to work both independently and as an effective team player in a highly dynamic environment Meticulous and an eye for details High standard of integrity, drive and sense of urgency

Job_Title: BILLING EXECUTIVE, REGISTRY SERVICES (2-year contract position)
Location: Supreme Court Lane, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179803, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description The Singapore Academy of Law (“SAL”) is a promotion and development agency for Singapore’s legal industry. Our vision is to make Singapore the legal hub of Asia. The Singapore Mediation Centre (“SMC”) is a subsidiary of the Academy. Established in 1997, SMC pioneered the use of mediation as the mainstream mechanism for dispute resolution, as well as training in negotiation and conflict management. Today, SMC offers a suite of alternative dispute resolution services which brings clarity and objectivity to complex situations. These services include mediation, adjudication, neutral evaluation and domain name dispute resolution. Through our panel of professional mediators with legal and industry expertise, SMC is well-placed to manage difficult negotiations and unlock standstills for businesses by providing cost-effective and timely solutions. At SMC, our vision is to help all businesses fully appreciate the value of mediation as a strategic risk-management tool that they can count on in commercial dealings. Responsibilities: You will support the administration of cases by managing the financial aspects of case files that are administered by SMC’s Registry team. This includes, but not limited to, SMC’s core services for Mediation and Adjudication. You will require familiarity with using SMC’s inhouse enterprise resource planning software – Business Central – to create customer cards, input data and generate invoicing (including e-invoicing) for case files. You will be required to liaise closely with the Finance department on invoicing, receipts, and other financial aspects between SMC’s Registry team and the Finance department. You may also be required to undertake other ad hoc duties in relation to the financial aspects of case files as and when required (e.g. collection and dispatch of cheques/documents). Requirements: Have familiarity with Business Central and MS Office. Be meticulous and organized, possess initiative, and are able to multitask to meet deadlines. Preferably have work experience related to Finance and/or Accounting. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends
